Benign Nevus.description: A benign nevus is a common mole that is typically harmless.

Malignant Melanoma.description: A dangerous form of skin cancer that can spread rapidly.

Fungal.description: Fungal infections such as ringworm or athlete’s foot.

Eczema.description: Dry, itchy, inflamed skin often triggered by irritants.

Benign Tumor.description: Non-cancerous growths like lipomas or dermatofibromas.

Acneiform.description: Pimples, blackheads, and whiteheads caused by clogged pores.

Viral.description: Viral skin lesions such as herpes or molluscum contagiosum.

Psoriasis.description: Autoimmune condition causing scaly, red patches on skin.

Malignant.description: General category for malignant skin lesions.

Autoimmune.description: Immune-mediated skin disorders like lupus or lichen planus.

Alopecia.description: Hair loss conditions, such as alopecia areata.

Pigmentation.description: Disorders like melasma or vitiligo affecting skin color.

Pre Malignant Lesion.description: Lesions that may evolve into cancer if untreated.

Bacterial.description: Bacterial infections such as impetigo or cellulitis.

Nail Disorder.description: Conditions affecting nails, e.g., onycholysis or Beau’s lines.

Other.description: Miscellaneous skin conditions not in other categories.

Benign Keratosis.description: Non-cancerous keratoses such as seborrheic keratosis.
